author: Staff Reporter
text:
He allegedly demanded Rs.50,000 as bribe

Officials from the Directorate of Vigilance and Anti-Corruption (DVAC) on Wednesday arrested a head clerk attached with the Vadalur Sub-Registrar office on charges of allegedly demanding and accepting bribe for releasing property document to a farmer.

According to Vigilance police, Mohan Raj, head clerk in the Vadalur sub-registrar office, had demanded Rs.50,000 as bribe from the complainant, Senthil Kumar, for releasing a document relating to a cashew orchard registered by the latter in 2013 in Kadampuliyur.

Senthil Kumar lodged a complaint with the Vigilance police who laid a trap and asked the complainant to hand over currency notes coated with chemical solution.

Mohan Raj was arrested while accepting the bribe. A case has been registered in this connection.
title: Head clerk held on graft charges
